functional_data.summary: Mutations in KCNH2 lead to increased IKr density, contributing to Brugada syndrome.

variants.additional_notes: The KCNH2 gene is thought to play a modifying role in BrS.
key_quotes: the KCNH2 gene is thought to play a modifying role in BrS.
Both mutations led to an increased IKr density and caused a negative shift of voltage-dependent inactivation, resulting in increased rectification.
